Name: "Parasite"
Info: Directed by Bong Joon-ho, South Korea, 2019
Description: A poor family infiltrates a wealthy household, exposing class divisions and social hypocrisy in modern Seoul through suspense and dark humor.

Name: "Coco"
Info: Directed by Lee Unkrich, Mexico / USA, 2017
Description: Celebrates Mexican traditions like Día de Muertos and the importance of family and remembering loved ones.

Name: "Pan’s Labyrinth"
Info: Directed by Guillermo del Toro, Spain, 2006
Description: A dark fairy tale set after the Spanish Civil War that blends mythology, innocence, and the brutality of fascism.

Name: "Things Fall Apart"
Description: Depicts the clash between traditional Igbo culture and British colonial rule, showing the impact on one man’s identity.

Name: "One Hundred Years of Solitude"
Info: Written by Gabriel García Márquez, Colombia, 1967
Description: Chronicles several generations of the Buendía family, mixing myth, history, and Latin American culture.

Name: "The Tale of Genji"
Info: Written by Murasaki Shikibu, Japan, 11th century
Description: Considered the world’s first novel, portraying love, beauty, and court life in Japan’s Heian period.

Name: "Water No Get Enemy"
Description: Blends jazz, funk, and Yoruba rhythms with lyrics about unity, resilience, and political resistance.

Name: "Alfonsina y el Mar"
Description: A poetic tribute to Argentine poet Alfonsina Storni, mixing folklore and themes of womanhood and freedom.

Name: "Spring Day"
Description: Combines emotional storytelling and cultural reflection on friendship, loss, and hope.
